snippet: Mr. Christopher was author of the “Tripods” trilogy among many other books under many other names.
abstract: John Christopher, prolific British science fiction writer, dies at age 89.

headline.main: John Christopher, Science Fiction Writer, Dies at 89

snippet: Alan Turing, the British mathematician and cryptanalyst, has been denied a formal pardon by the government of Prime Minister David Cameron for his conviction in 1952 on charges of homosexuality.
abstract: Alan Turing, British mathematician and cryptanalyst, is denied a formal pardon by the government of Prime Min David Cameron for his conviction in 1952 on charges of homosexuality.

snippet: Two days after their season ended with a tense victory over the New England Patriots in Super Bowl XLVI, the Giants took a confetti-filled victory lap in Lower Manhattan.
abstract: New York Giants Super Bowl victory parade in Lower Manhattan is an occasion for many fans to take off from work and school.

headline.main: Skipping School and Work? They Just Felt Blue
headline.print_headline: Skipping School and Work? They Just Felt Blue

snippet: To fix a flaw in our tax system, mark-to-market taxation would require the superwealthy to pay at least a little income tax on their unsold stock shares.
abstract: Op-Ed article by tax lawyer David S Miller notes that Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg will likely never pay any taxes on the majority of the shares in the company he owns due to the nature of the current tax code; argues that the tax system should be reformed so that the superwealthy pay at least a little income tax on their unsold shares of successful companies.

snippet: John B. Rhea came to the city agency with extensive credentials in banking but no experience in housing, and proceeded to become a provocative figure.
abstract: New York City Housing Authority Chairman John B Rhea has turned into a provocative figure since he was installed in 2009, credited with shaking up the bureaucracy and securing desperately needed federal grants; he has also stirred criticism and touched off an exodus of seasoned senior officials, endangering the future of the agency itself, by far the largest housing agency in the country and responsible for sheltering 600,000 people.

headline.main: Bruised Feelings or No, Chairman Applies Jolt to Housing Authority
headline.print_headline: Bruised Feelings or No, Chairman Applies Jolt To Housing Authority

snippet: In more troubling news for Research In Motion, Halliburton, the energy services company, has announced plans to ditch corporate support for the BlackBerry in favor of Apple's iPhone. It's yet another example of how the iPhone is eating the BlackBe...
abstract: In more troubling news for Research In Motion, Halliburton, the energy services company, has announced plans to ditch corporate support for the BlackBerry in favor of Apple's iPhone. It's yet another example of how the iPhone is eating the BlackBerry's lunch in the area it once dominated: business customers.

snippet: For iPhone and iPad owners looking for software in Apple's App Store, it is easy to be overwhelmed by the hundreds of thousands of available apps. To stand out in the crowd, some app makers have apparently found ways to game the system.
abstract: For iPhone and iPad owners looking for software in Apple's App Store, it is easy to be overwhelmed by the hundreds of thousands of available apps. To stand out in the crowd, some app makers have apparently found ways to game the system.

headline.main: Apple Fights App Makers Who Try to Game the System
